data.title: New place with brand new decor
data.text: When people get to know this place, just off Mass., they'll flock here. The windows are big, there's a side room decorated in Victoriana, and the service is excellent. We left just before it closed after lunch and the waitress gave us the rest of the sweet rolls from breakfast to take home--such a nice touch--explaining she'd have to throw them out. So I know for sure the baked goods (a yummy sticky bun) are fresh daily.

data.title: Best hamburger i've ever eaten.
data.text: Awesome speak easy atmosphere and friendly wait staff.  I've eaten here numerous times.  Hamburgers are great as well as the appetizers.

data.title: Ok not out standing
data.text: Stopped for drinks warm surroundings but wait staff on the cold side. Had to go up to bar to get our own beers. There was about 5 people in the place...

data.title: Perfect spot on a rainy Monday night
data.text: We were walking around downtown, stopping at old haunts and checking out the many new establishments ( haven't been thru in 5 years, left town 15 years ago) when we saw a set of stairs leading down to what looked a cozy, candlelit bar.  It was gorgeous. Exposed rock, low ceilings, great wood furniture and a well stocked bar.  It's small and gorgeous.  We had one of each slider and a veggie bierock.  The bierock was fantastic, tasted like thanksgiving in a delicious, golden pastry.  The sliders were good, too.  It was a totally dead night so we got to chat with the bartender about the space.  I can't remember her name (we'd been to a few places by then 😉) but she took us on a tour of the rest of the property which included a great space upstairs with huge windows overlooking the street.  would make a great restaurant....  The rest of the menu looked delicious.

data.title: cool place for sure but could use a little improving
data.text:
Damn cool atmosphere, I love the mural on the wall it's fly for sure. 

But the drink menu needs to be reworked a little. Merchants and 715 have it beat. And they're expensive. 

The food is pretty good but it's kind of an odd menu, IMO. 

Oh (last complaint) it's a little cramped in there. I can fill up fast. 

But you should go! Everyone should go at least once in their short lives...

data.title: Great Atmosphere Mediocre Wait Staff
data.text: I like this place for a drink, but our last trip was not good. We waited for the table to be cleared, we waited for a menu, we waited to place an order, we waited for a drink, we waited to pay our tab. To be fair it appeared they had one person working the floor and they did not appear to know what to do.

data.title: Cozy little speakeasy
data.text:
Don't be intimidated by the lack of signage and the mysterious vibe!  It's a friendly little bar, and it is easy to find.  Just look for the chalk menuboard sign out front, and take the stairs down.  If the outside light is red, it is busy and there is a wait (they'll have someone at the door in that case, to tell you how long of a wait).  If it's not busy, head right on in.  

We have only had to wait once, and it was during the holiday season.  Any other time we've come around 9 or 10, and had no issues getting seats at the bar.  The bartenders are always very friendly and talkative.  

There is a menu here, but it's a step above regular bar food--the Speakeasy sandwich is a personal favorite (bourbon smoked bacon, brie, and fig jam).  They also make the best French 75 I've ever had!  The atmosphere is very relaxed, and customers are from across the age spectrum--you'll find folks alone, doing some reading, a few college students, folks out on dates.  Make sure to check out their take on the John Brown mural!
